chapter.title: Lists
chapter.para: If you use a list, include more than one list item. If you only have one list item, remove the list and rephrase the information using one or two sentences. Doing so removes unnecessary structure. Use only one type of list at a time; avoid * foo: A tool that ..., where * signifies an unordered list and : signifies a definition list.

section.title: Ordered
section.para: Use an ordered (or numbered) list for instructions that must be performed in a particular order.

section.title: Unordered
section.para: Use an unordered (or bulleted) list for items, or instructions that can be performed in a any order. Put the most important information at the top because that is where readers pay more attention.

section.title: Definition
section.para: Use an definition (or variable) list for terms and definitions.
